pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a08a58188f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15407/commits/a08a58188f03ee83f9b456b7d2e4356753628bd4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsIrreducible.closure_genericPoint`
`+ IsIrreducible.isGenericPoint_genericPoint`
`+ IsIrreducible.isGenericPoint_genericPoint_closure`
`+ closure`
`+ component`
`+ component_injective`
`+ component_ofComponent`
`+ component_surjective`
`+ equiv`
`+ finite`
`+ genericPoints`
`+ genericPoints_eq_singleton`
`+ irreducibleComponents_eq_singleton`
`+ isGenericPoint`
`+ isGenericPoint_ofComponent`
`+ ofComponent`
`+ ofComponent_component`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I am by no means used to the conventions around these things, but isn't `genericPoints` a bit too vague of a name ? As in, I would expect it to be the set of points generic in the whole space (granted, this is useless when you have a non-irreducible space). But if you think there's no risk of misunderstanding I'll believe you.
I might be misunderstanding you, but isn't the definition proposed in this PR exactly what you described (when the space is irreducible)?

Yes it is, it's just that, purely from the name `genericPoints`, I was expecting it to be empty in the non-irreducible setting ðŸ˜… 

Really the only thing is that it sounds surprising to have `IsGenericPoint` and `genericPoints` not being as trivially related as the names might suggest. But since one needs 10 seconds to understand the subtlety I think it doesn't matter much and you can ignore my comments.

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382012232/job/31664638703)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382012232/job/31664639019)
bors d+
LGTM!
I only have some comments about `IsIrreducible.genericPoint_spec'`, other than that it all looks good!
LGTM!
bors d+

The following might be out of scope of this PR, but to me it feels a bit odd that this version has the `'`, and that it is not immediate by definition, given how `QuasiSober` is defined (that closed irr sets have generic points).

I understand that it is useful for `IsIrreducible.genericPoint` to make sense for non-closed sets as well, but then shouldn't the definition of `QuasiSober` already reflect that? So that its defining property would instead be
` sober : âˆ€ {S : Set Î±}, IsIrreducible S â†’ âˆƒ x, IsGenericPoint x (closure S)`
Then it would make more sense to me that the prime versions are for the case of closed sets.
I changed the names a bit. Please check if you like them.
Could you add a prime version of this too, so the fact that when `S` is closed the closure of its generic point equals S.

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma component_ofComponent [QuasiSober Î±] (x : irreducibleComponents Î±) :
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma ofComponent_component [T0Space Î±] [QuasiSober Î±] (x : genericPoints Î±) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology): set of generic points of generic components
